issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Description:
While testing Kitchensink,Phone>Sound>Remote tests, I pressed the "stop" button and expected the stream to stop. When I started the stream again, the stream started again from the locations where I stopped it. This behavior is the same as the "pause" button.

Steps to reproduce:
1) Install KS 1.8.0 on Nexus S
2) Navigate to Phone>Sound>Remote tests
3) Start the stream
4) Press "stop"
5) Start the stream again

Result:
The stream continues from where it was "stopped"

Expected result:
The stream resets and begins from the start of the stream again

Notes:
Also occurs with 1.7.2
fields.summary: Kitchensink: Phone>Sound>Remote tests, stop stream button acts as pause stream
fields.environment: Titanium Studio, build: 1.0.4.201108101535, SDK 1.8.0.v20110819142548 on Nexus S 2.3.4, Xoom 3.2

comments.body:
Bug still persists on:

SDK build: 1.8.0.1, 1.9.0.v20120118184633
Runtime: V8
Titanium Studio, build: 1.0.8.201201181442
Device: Galaxy Tab 10.1 (3.1)

Note: 
* After pressing the stop button, the following message appears in logcat:
{code}
E/AwesomePlayer(  226): calling pause
E/AwesomePlayer(  226): calling pause_l
{code}
* This bug persists for any of the sound tests in KS
Resolving ticket as invalid as this version of Kitchen Sink is no longer supported.
